bibl.title: William L. Tobias v. Territory of Washington. Subpoena
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
Territory of Washington, Third Judiical District. ss. To Judge C. M. Rivers
In the name of the United States of America, You are hereby commanded to be and appear at the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, at Seattle, for the District aforesaid at o'clock in the noon of the day of forthwith A. D. 188 , then and there to give evidence in a certain cause therin pending, wherein Territory of Washington Plaintiff and Wm J Tobias Defendant and to remain in attendance on said Court day to day thereafter until discharged, and herein fail not at your peril. and with you bring the information heard and in said case have in your hands Witness on behalf
Witness, the HON. Richard A. Jones C H Hanford Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said District Court, this 28th day of September 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By H. T. Harmon Deputy.

T
No. 7255 In the District Court, holding terms at Seattle, Washington Terr. SUBPOENA. Ter. of Wash Plaintiff vs Wm J Tobias Defendant
FILED SEP 28 1889

Territory of Washington, County of King. ss.
I hereby Certify that I served the within Subpoena on the 28th day of September A. D. 1889, and personally served the same on Judge C. M. Rivers by reading the same to him each of them in King County, Washington Territory, on the 28th day of September A. D. 1889.
Dated King County, W. T., 28 day of September A. D. 1889. J. H. McGraw Sheriff By D R McKinley Dep
Fees. Serving Subpoena, - - $ .40 Mileage 2 Miles, $ .20 Certificate $.50 / 1.10
